pokemons.name: bulbasaur
pokemons.description:
a strange seed was
planted on its
back at birth. the plant sprouts
and grows with
this POKéMON.

pokemons.name: ivysaur
pokemons.description:
when the bulb on
its back grows
large, it appears to lose the
ability to stand
on its hind legs.

pokemons.name: venusaur
pokemons.description:
the plant blooms
when it is
absorbing solar energy. It stays
on the move to
seek sunlight.

pokemons.name: charmander
pokemons.description:
Obviously prefers
hot places. When
it rains, steam is said to spout
from the tip of
its tail.

pokemons.name: charmeleon
pokemons.description:
When it swings
its burning tail,
it elevates the temperature to
unbearably high
levels.

pokemons.name: charizard
pokemons.description:
Spits fire that
is hot enough to
melt boulders. Known to cause
forest fires
unintentionally.

pokemons.name: squirtle
pokemons.description:
After birth, its
back swells and
hardens into a shell. Powerfully
sprays foam from
its mouth.

pokemons.name: wartortle
pokemons.description:
Often hides in
water to stalk
unwary prey. For swimming fast, it
moves its ears to
maintain balance.

pokemons.name: blastoise
pokemons.description:
A brutal POKéMON
with pressurized
water jets on its shell. They are
used for high
speed tackles.

pokemons.name: caterpie
pokemons.description:
Its short feet are tipped with suction
pads that enable it to tirelessly climb
slopes and walls.

pokemons.name: metapod
pokemons.description:
This POKéMON is
vulnerable to
attack while its shell is soft,
exposing its weak
and tender body.

pokemons.name: butterfree
pokemons.description:
In battle, it
flaps its wings
at high speed to release highly
toxic dust into
the air.

pokemons.name: weedle
pokemons.description:
Often found in
forests, eating
leaves. It has a sharp
venomous stinger
on its head.

pokemons.name: kakuna
pokemons.description:
Almost incapable
of moving, this
POKéMON can only harden its shell
to protect itself
from predators.

pokemons.name: beedrill
pokemons.description:
It has three poisonous stingers on its forelegs and
its tail. They are used to jab its enemy repeatedly.

pokemons.name: pidgey
pokemons.description:
A common sight in
forests and woods.
It flaps its wings at ground
level to kick up
blinding sand.

pokemons.name: pidgeotto
pokemons.description:
Very protective
of its sprawling
territorial area, this POKéMON will
fiercely peck at
any intruder.

pokemons.name: pidgeot
pokemons.description:
When hunting, it
skims the surface
of water at high speed to pick off
unwary prey such
as MAGIKARP.

pokemons.name: rattata
pokemons.description:
Bites anything
when it attacks.
Small and very quick, it is a
common sight in
many places.

pokemons.name: raticate
pokemons.description:
It uses its whis­
kers to maintain
its balance. It apparently
slows down if
they are cut off.

pokemons.name: spearow
pokemons.description:
It flaps its small wings busily to
fly. Using its beak, it searches
in grass for prey.

pokemons.name: fearow
pokemons.description:
With its huge and
magnificent wings,
it can keep aloft without ever
having to land
for rest.

pokemons.name: ekans
pokemons.description:
Moves silently
and stealthily.
Eats the eggs of birds, such as
PIDGEY and
SPEAROW, whole.

pokemons.name: arbok
pokemons.description:
It is rumored that
the ferocious
warning markings on its belly
differ from area
to area.

pokemons.name: pikachu
pokemons.description:
When several of
these POKéMON
gather, their electricity could
build and cause
lightning storms.

pokemons.name: raichu
pokemons.description:
Its long tail serves as a ground to protect itself
from its own high-voltage power.

pokemons.name: sandshrew
pokemons.description:
Burrows deep
underground in
arid locations far from water.
It only emerges
to hunt for food.

pokemons.name: sandslash
pokemons.description:
Curls up into a
spiny ball when
threatened. It can roll while
curled up to
attack or escape.

pokemons.name: nidoran-f
pokemons.description:
Although small,
its venomous
barbs render this POKéMON dangerous.
The female has
smaller horns.

pokemons.name: nidorina
pokemons.description:
The female's horn
develops slowly.
Prefers physical attacks such as
clawing and
biting.

pokemons.name: nidoqueen
pokemons.description:
Its hard scales
provide strong
protection. It uses its hefty
bulk to execute
powerful moves.

pokemons.name: nidoran-m
pokemons.description:
Stiffens its ears
to sense danger.
The larger its horns, the more
powerful its
secreted venom.

pokemons.name: nidorino
pokemons.description:
An aggressive
POKéMON that is
quick to attack. The horn on its
head secretes a
powerful venom.

pokemons.name: nidoking
pokemons.description:
It uses its
powerful tail in
battle to smash, constrict, then
break the prey's
bones.

pokemons.name: clefairy
pokemons.description:
Its magical and
cute appeal has
many admirers. It is rare and
found only in
certain areas.

pokemons.name: clefable
pokemons.description:
A timid fairy
POKéMON that is
rarely seen. It will run and hide
the moment it
senses people.

pokemons.name: vulpix
pokemons.description:
At the time of
birth, it has
just one tail. The tail splits
from its tip as
it grows older.

pokemons.name: ninetales
pokemons.description:
Very smart and
very vengeful.
Grabbing one of its many tails
could result in a
1000-year curse.

pokemons.name: jigglypuff
pokemons.description:
When its huge eyes
light up, it sings
a mysteriously soothing melody
that lulls its
enemies to sleep.

pokemons.name: wigglytuff
pokemons.description:
The body is soft
and rubbery. When
angered, it will suck in air and
inflate itself to
an enormous size.

pokemons.name: zubat
pokemons.description:
Forms colonies in
perpetually dark
places. Uses ultrasonic waves
to identify and
approach targets.

pokemons.name: golbat
pokemons.description:
Once it strikes,
it will not stop
draining energy from the victim
even if it gets
too heavy to fly.

pokemons.name: oddish
pokemons.description:
During the day,
it keeps its face
buried in the ground. At night,
it wanders around
sowing its seeds.

pokemons.name: gloom
pokemons.description:
The fluid that
oozes from its
mouth isn't drool. It is a nectar
that is used to
attract prey.

pokemons.name: vileplume
pokemons.description:
It has the world’s largest petals. With every step,
the petals shake out heavy clouds of toxic pollen.

pokemons.name: paras
pokemons.description:
Burrows to suck
tree roots. The
mushrooms on its back grow by draw­
ing nutrients from
the bug host.

pokemons.name: parasect
pokemons.description:
A host-parasite
pair in which the
parasite mushroom has taken over the
host bug. Prefers
damp places.

pokemons.name: venonat
pokemons.description:
Lives in the
shadows of tall
trees where it eats insects. It
is attracted by
light at night.

pokemons.name: venomoth
pokemons.description:
The dustlike scales covering its wings
are color-coded to indicate the kinds of
poison it has.

pokemons.name: diglett
pokemons.description:
Lives about one
yard underground
where it feeds on plant roots. It
sometimes appears
above ground.

pokemons.name: dugtrio
pokemons.description:
A team of DIGLETT
triplets.
It triggers huge earthquakes by
burrowing 60 miles
underground.

pokemons.name: meowth
pokemons.description:
It washes its face regularly to keep the coin on
its forehead spotless. It doesn’t get along with
Galarian Meowth.

pokemons.name: persian
pokemons.description:
Although its fur
has many admirers,
it is tough to raise as a pet
because of its
fickle meanness.

pokemons.name: psyduck
pokemons.description:
While lulling its
enemies with its
vacant look, this wily POKéMON will
use psychokinetic
powers.

pokemons.name: golduck
pokemons.description:
Often seen swim­
ming elegantly by
lake shores. It is often mistaken
for the Japanese
monster, Kappa.

pokemons.name: mankey
pokemons.description:
Extremely quick to
anger. It could
be docile one moment then
thrashing away
the next instant.

pokemons.name: primeape
pokemons.description:
Always furious
and tenacious to
boot. It will not abandon chasing
its quarry until
it is caught.

pokemons.name: growlithe
pokemons.description:
Very protective
of its territory.
It will bark and bite to repel
intruders from
its space.

pokemons.name: arcanine
pokemons.description:
A POKéMON that
has been admired
since the past for its beauty.
It runs agilely
as if on wings.

pokemons.name: poliwag
pokemons.description:
Its newly grown
legs prevent it
from running. It appears to prefer
swimming than
trying to stand.

pokemons.name: poliwhirl
pokemons.description:
Capable of living
in or out of
water. When out of water, it
sweats to keep
its body slimy.

pokemons.name: poliwrath
pokemons.description:
An adept swimmer
at both the front
crawl and breast stroke. Easily
overtakes the best
human swimmers.

pokemons.name: abra
pokemons.description:
Using its ability
to read minds, it
will identify impending danger
and TELEPORT to
safety.

pokemons.name: kadabra
pokemons.description:
It emits special
alpha waves from
its body that induce headaches
just by being
close by.

pokemons.name: alakazam
pokemons.description:
Its brain can out­
perform a super­
computer. Its intelligence
quotient is said
to be 5,000.

pokemons.name: machop
pokemons.description:
Loves to build
its muscles.
It trains in all styles of martial
arts to become
even stronger.

pokemons.name: machoke
pokemons.description:
Its muscular body
is so powerful, it
must wear a power save belt to be
able to regulate
its motions.

pokemons.name: machamp
pokemons.description:
Using its heavy
muscles, it throws
powerful punches that can send the
victim clear over
the horizon.

pokemons.name: bellsprout
pokemons.description:
A carnivorous
POKéMON that traps
and eats bugs. It uses its root
feet to soak up
needed moisture.

pokemons.name: weepinbell
pokemons.description:
It spits out
POISONPOWDER to
immobilize the enemy and then
finishes it with
a spray of ACID.

pokemons.name: victreebel
pokemons.description:
Said to live in
huge colonies
deep in jungles, although no one
has ever returned
from there.

pokemons.name: tentacool
pokemons.description:
Drifts in shallow
seas. Anglers who
hook them by accident are
often punished by
its stinging acid.

pokemons.name: tentacruel
pokemons.description:
The tentacles are
normally kept
short. On hunts, they are extended
to ensnare and
immobilize prey.

pokemons.name: geodude
pokemons.description:
Found in fields
and mountains.
Mistaking them for boulders,
people often step
or trip on them.

pokemons.name: graveler
pokemons.description:
Rolls down slopes
to move. It rolls
over any obstacle without slowing
or changing its
direction.

pokemons.name: golem
pokemons.description:
Its boulder-like
body is extremely
hard. It can easily withstand
dynamite blasts
without damage.

pokemons.name: ponyta
pokemons.description:
Its hooves are 10
times harder than
diamonds. It can trample anything
completely flat
in little time.

pokemons.name: rapidash
pokemons.description:
Very competitive,
this POKéMON will
chase anything that moves fast
in the hopes of
racing it.

pokemons.name: slowpoke
pokemons.description:
Incredibly slow
and dopey. It
takes 5 seconds for it to feel
pain when under
attack.

pokemons.name: slowbro
pokemons.description:
The SHELLDER that
is latched onto
SLOWPOKE's tail is said to feed
on the host's left
over scraps.

pokemons.name: magnemite
pokemons.description:
Uses anti-gravity
to stay suspended.
Appears without warning and uses
THUNDER WAVE and
similar moves.

pokemons.name: magneton
pokemons.description:
Formed by several
MAGNEMITEs linked
together. They frequently appear
when sunspots
flare up.

pokemons.name: farfetchd
pokemons.description:
The sprig of
green onions it
holds is its weapon. It is
used much like a
metal sword.

pokemons.name: doduo
pokemons.description:
A bird that makes
up for its poor
flying with its fast foot speed.
Leaves giant
footprints.

pokemons.name: dodrio
pokemons.description:
Uses its three
brains to execute
complex plans. While two heads
sleep, one head
stays awake.

pokemons.name: seel
pokemons.description:
The protruding
horn on its head
is very hard. It is used for
bashing through
thick ice.

pokemons.name: dewgong
pokemons.description:
Stores thermal
energy in its
body. Swims at a steady 8 knots
even in intensely
cold waters.

pokemons.name: grimer
pokemons.description:
Appears in filthy
areas. Thrives by
sucking up polluted sludge
that is pumped
out of factories.

pokemons.name: muk
pokemons.description:
Thickly covered
with a filthy,
vile sludge. It is so toxic, even
its footprints
contain poison.

pokemons.name: shellder
pokemons.description:
Its hard shell
repels any kind
of attack. It is vulnerable
only when its
shell is open.

pokemons.name: cloyster
pokemons.description:
When attacked, it
launches its
horns in quick volleys. Its
innards have
never been seen.

pokemons.name: gastly
pokemons.description:
Almost invisible,
this gaseous
POKéMON cloaks the target and
puts it to sleep
without notice.

pokemons.name: haunter
pokemons.description:
Because of its
ability to slip
through block walls, it is said
to be from an­
other dimension.

pokemons.name: gengar
pokemons.description:
Under a full moon,
this POKéMON
likes to mimic the shadows of
people and laugh
at their fright.

pokemons.name: onix
pokemons.description:
As it grows, the
stone portions of
its body harden to become similar
to a diamond, but
colored black.

pokemons.name: drowzee
pokemons.description:
Puts enemies to
sleep then eats
their dreams. Occasionally gets
sick from eating
bad dreams.

pokemons.name: hypno
pokemons.description:
When it locks eyes
with an enemy, it
will use a mix of PSI moves such as
HYPNOSIS and
CONFUSION.

pokemons.name: krabby
pokemons.description:
Its pincers are
not only powerful
weapons, they are used for balance
when walking
sideways.

pokemons.name: kingler
pokemons.description:
The large pincer
has 10000 hp of
crushing power. However, its huge
size makes it
unwieldy to use.

pokemons.name: voltorb
pokemons.description:
Usually found in
power plants.
Easily mistaken for a POKé BALL,
they have zapped
many people.

pokemons.name: electrode
pokemons.description:
It stores electric
energy under very
high pressure. It often explodes
with little or no
provocation.

pokemons.name: exeggcute
pokemons.description:
Often mistaken
for eggs.
When disturbed, they quickly
gather and attack
in swarms.

pokemons.name: exeggutor
pokemons.description:
Legend has it that
on rare occasions,
one of its heads will drop off and
continue on as an
EXEGGCUTE.

pokemons.name: cubone
pokemons.description:
Because it never
removes its skull
helmet, no one has ever seen
this POKéMON's
real face.

pokemons.name: marowak
pokemons.description:
The bone it holds
is its key weapon.
It throws the bone skillfully
like a boomerang
to KO targets.

pokemons.name: hitmonlee
pokemons.description:
When in a hurry,
its legs lengthen
progressively. It runs smoothly
with extra long,
loping strides.

pokemons.name: hitmonchan
pokemons.description:
While apparently
doing nothing, it
fires punches in lightning fast
volleys that are
impossible to see.

pokemons.name: lickitung
pokemons.description:
Its tongue can be
extended like a
chameleon's. It leaves a tingling
sensation when it
licks enemies.

pokemons.name: koffing
pokemons.description:
Because it stores
several kinds of
toxic gases in its body, it is
prone to exploding
without warning.

pokemons.name: weezing
pokemons.description:
Where two kinds
of poison gases
meet, 2 KOFFINGs can fuse into a
WEEZING over many
years.

pokemons.name: rhyhorn
pokemons.description:
A POKéMON with a
one-track mind.
Once it charges,  it won't stop
running until it
falls asleep.

pokemons.name: rhydon
pokemons.description:
Protected by an
armor-like hide,
it is capable of living in molten
lava of 3,600
degrees.

pokemons.name: chansey
pokemons.description:
A rare and elusive
POKéMON that is
said to bring happiness to those
who manage to get
it.

pokemons.name: tangela
pokemons.description:
The whole body is
swathed with wide
vines that are similar to sea­
weed. Its vines
shake as it walks.

pokemons.name: kangaskhan
pokemons.description:
The infant rarely
ventures out of
its mother's protective pouch
until it is 3
years old.

pokemons.name: horsea
pokemons.description:
Known to shoot
down flying bugs
with precision blasts of ink
from the surface
of the water.

pokemons.name: seadra
pokemons.description:
Capable of swim­
ming backwards by
rapidly flapping its wing-like
pectoral fins and
stout tail.

pokemons.name: goldeen
pokemons.description:
Its tail fin
billows like an
elegant ballroom dress, giving it
the nickname of
the Water Queen.

pokemons.name: seaking
pokemons.description:
In the autumn spawning season, they can
be seen swimming powerfully up rivers and
creeks.

pokemons.name: staryu
pokemons.description:
If its body is torn, it can grow
back if the red core remains.
The core flashes at midnight.

pokemons.name: starmie
pokemons.description:
Its central core
glows with the
seven colors of the rainbow. Some
people value the
core as a gem.

pokemons.name: mr-mime
pokemons.description:
If interrupted
while it is
miming, it will slap around the
offender with its
broad hands.

pokemons.name: scyther
pokemons.description:
With ninja-like
agility and speed,
it can create the illusion that
there is more
than one.

pokemons.name: jynx
pokemons.description:
It seductively
wiggles its hips
as it walks. It can cause people
to dance in
unison with it.

pokemons.name: electabuzz
pokemons.description:
Normally found
near power plants,
they can wander away and cause
major blackouts
in cities.

pokemons.name: magmar
pokemons.description:
Its body always
burns with an
orange glow that enables it to
hide perfectly
among flames.

pokemons.name: pinsir
pokemons.description:
If it fails to
crush the victim
in its pincers, it will swing it
around and toss
it hard.

pokemons.name: tauros
pokemons.description:
When it targets
an enemy, it
charges furiously while whipping its
body with its
long tails.

pokemons.name: magikarp
pokemons.description:
In the distant
past, it was
somewhat stronger than the horribly
weak descendants
that exist today.

pokemons.name: gyarados
pokemons.description:
Once it begins to rampage, a
GYARADOS will burn everything
down, even in a harsh storm.

pokemons.name: lapras
pokemons.description:
A POKéMON that
has been over­
hunted almost to extinction. It
can ferry people
across the water.

pokemons.name: ditto
pokemons.description:
Capable of copying
an enemy's genetic
code to instantly transform itself
into a duplicate
of the enemy.

pokemons.name: eevee
pokemons.description:
Its genetic code
is irregular.
It may mutate if it is exposed to
radiation from
element STONEs.

pokemons.name: vaporeon
pokemons.description:
Lives close to
water. Its long
tail is ridged with a fin which
is often mistaken
for a mermaid's.

pokemons.name: jolteon
pokemons.description:
It accumulates
negative ions in
the atmosphere to blast out 10000-
volt lightning
bolts.

pokemons.name: flareon
pokemons.description:
When storing
thermal energy in
its body, its temperature could
soar to over 1600
degrees.

pokemons.name: porygon
pokemons.description:
A POKéMON that
consists entirely
of programming code. Capable of
moving freely in
cyberspace.

pokemons.name: omanyte
pokemons.description:
Although long
extinct, in rare
cases, it can be genetically
resurrected from
fossils.

pokemons.name: omastar
pokemons.description:
A prehistoric
POKéMON that died
out when its heavy shell made
it impossible to
catch prey.

pokemons.name: kabuto
pokemons.description:
A POKéMON that
was resurrected
from a fossil found in what was
once the ocean
floor eons ago.

pokemons.name: kabutops
pokemons.description:
Its sleek shape is
perfect for swim­
ming. It slashes prey with its
claws and drains
the body fluids.

pokemons.name: aerodactyl
pokemons.description:
A Pokémon that roamed the skies
in the dinosaur era. Its teeth are
like saw blades.

pokemons.name: snorlax
pokemons.description:
Very lazy. Just
eats and sleeps.
As its rotund bulk builds, it
becomes steadily
more slothful.

pokemons.name: articuno
pokemons.description:
A legendary bird
POKéMON that is
said to appear to doomed people who
are lost in icy
mountains.

pokemons.name: zapdos
pokemons.description:
A legendary bird
POKéMON that is
said to appear from clouds while
dropping enormous
lightning bolts.

pokemons.name: moltres
pokemons.description:
Known as the
legendary bird of
fire. Every flap of its wings
creates a dazzling
flash of flames.

pokemons.name: dratini
pokemons.description:
Long considered a
mythical POKéMON
until recently when a small
colony was found
living underwater.

pokemons.name: dragonair
pokemons.description:
A mystical POKéMON
that exudes a
gentle aura. Has the ability
to change climate
conditions.

pokemons.name: dragonite
pokemons.description:
An extremely
rarely seen
marine POKéMON. Its intelligence
is said to match
that of humans.

pokemons.name: mewtwo
pokemons.description:
It was created by
a scientist after
years of horrific gene splicing and
DNA engineering
experiments.

pokemons.name: mew
pokemons.description:
So rare that it
is still said to
be a mirage by many experts. Only
a few people have
seen it worldwide.
